intro: Erigeron dianthifolius, commonly known as the pinkweed, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly in the eastern and central regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a fuzzy texture, while its flowers are pink to purple in color. Erigeron dianthifolius is often found in wetland ecosystems and is an important component of the local flora in its native range.
